snippet: Can Plato's allegory of the cave shed light on the condition of addiction?
abstract: Can Plato's allegory of the cave shed light on the condition of addiction?
lead_paragraph: Philosophy is one of the oldest areas of inquiry. Out of control behavior fueled by alcohol and other drugs is one of the world's oldest problems. What could these old timers offer each other? Philosophy has a long, stable relationship with reason and more specifically, the relationship between reason, emotions and the will. Addiction seems to involve a total abdication of reason, a messy tangle of emotions and a lack of will.

headline.main: In the Cave: Philosophy and Addiction
